#Text=Tomioka
#Text=Tomioka ( 富岡 ) is a city in southwestern Gunma Prefecture , Japan .
#Text=By train
#Text=Tomioka is served by the non-JR Jōshin Line , which runs from the nearby railway hub at Takasaki .
#Text=The line has 8 stations in the city , but the main one is Jōshū-Tomioka .
#Text=There are usually one or two trains an hour from Takasaki to Jōshū-Tomioka , taking 40 minutes and ¥ 790 .
#Text=Jōshin Railway sells a combination ticket , which covers a return journey between Takasaki and Jōshū-Tomioka and admission to the Silk Mill , for ¥ 2140 ( a saving of ¥ 440 ) .
#Text=They also sell a one-day free ticket ( which allows unlimited travel on the line ) for ¥ 2220 .
#Text=The Jōshin Line is not covered by the Japan Rail Pass or the JR East Passes , but it is covered by the JR TOKYO Wide Pass , which is available to holders of non-Japanese passports .
#Text=Note also that the Jōshin Line does not accept IC Cards ( Suica , Pasmo , Icoca etc. )
#Text=By bus
#Text=Tomioka Interchange on the Jōshin-etsu Expressway ( about 2.5km south of the Silk Mill ) is served by a fairly frequent direct bus service towards Tokyo :

#Text=Seibu Bus and Chikuma Bus run 16 buses a day from Ikebukuro Station East Exit , Shimo-Ochiai Station , Nerima Ward Office , and Kawagoe -Matoba Bus Stop , taking 2 hours 5 minutes ( and continuing on to Karuizawa , Komoro or Ueda ) .
#Text=Two buses a day start back from Shinjuku .
#Text=Chikuma Bus also runs 2 buses a day from Tachikawa Station North Exit and Tamagawa-Jōsui Station , taking 2 hours 10 minutes ( and continuing on to Komoro or Ueda ) .
#Text=All of these buses cost ¥ 2100 .
#Text=You can buy two tickets for ¥ 3700 , or 4 tickets for ¥ 7200 .

#Text=Nippon Chūō Bus runs an overnight service from Osaka Namba ( OCAT ) and Kyoto Station Hachijō Exit to Nippon Chūō Taxi Tomioka Eigyōsho ( on the main road 350m south of Nishi-Tomioka Station and 500m northwest of the Silk Mill ) , taking 8 hours 15 minutes and ¥ 9200 ( ¥ 16,560 return , valid for 10 days ) .
#Text=Note that this bus leaves Tomioka for Kansai after 11:45pm , and arrives at Tomioka before 4:45am .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Jōshin Railway offers free bike rentals from 5 of its stations , including Jōshū-Tomioka and Jōshū-Ichinomiya .
#Text=See
#Text=Tomioka Silk Mill ( 富岡製糸場 ) , 1-1 Tomioka ( 15 minutes walk southwest of Jōshū-Tomioka Station ) .
#Text=9:00 - 17:00 ( last admission 16:30 ) .
#Text=Japan 's oldest modern silk mill , which was in operation between 1872 and 1987 .
#Text=It was designated a Historic Site in 2005 , an Important Cultural Property in 2006 , and both a National Treasure and a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2014 .
#Text=Nukisaki Shrine ( 貫前神社 ) , 1535 Ichinomiya ( 15 minutes walk northwest of Jōshū-Ichinomiya Station , 3 stops beyond Jōshū-Tomioka on the Jōshin Line ) .
#Text=The Ichinomiya for Kōzuke Province ( most of Gunma Prefecture ) .
#Text=Much of the shrine is an Important Cultural Property .
#Text=Gunma Safari Park ( 群馬サファリパーク ) , 1 Okamoto ( 15 minutes drive south of Jōshū-Tomioka Station , or 10 minutes drive south of Tomioka Interchange ) .
#Text=9:30 - 16:30 ( last admission 15:30 )
#Text=November-February , 9:30 - 17:00 ( last admission 16:00 )
#Text=March-October , closed Wednesdays .

#Text=This is the type of zoo where you either drive through in your own car ( in which case you must pay ¥ 500 for a guide radio , which is available in Japanese or English ) or are driven around ( ¥ 500 for the safari bus , or ¥ 1300 for either the feed-the-animals bus or the off-road ranger tour in a four wheel drive ) .

#Text=The most interesting animals are the white tigers and Japan 's only Sumatran elephants ; animals native to Japan include the snow monkeys ( Japanese macaques ) , black bears , sika deer , and Japanese squirrels .
#Text=There is also a rather child-centred amusement park with individually priced rides ( ¥200-¥ 400 ) .

#Text=Gunma Museum of Natural History ( 群馬県立自然史博物館 ) , 1674-1 Kamikuroiwa ( 10 minutes drive from Jōshū-Tomioka Station , 5 minutes drive from Jōshū-Ichinomiya Station , or 25 minutes walk from Jōshū-Nanokaichi Station ) .

column3: 群馬県立自然史博物館

column1: #Text=9:30am-5pm ( last admission 4:30pm ) , closed Mondays .
